NAME: Sriram Rajamani
ABOUT:
I am a Distinguished Scientist at Microsoft Research and Managing Director of Microsoft Research India.  Our lab does leading edge research spanning the following areas: (1) Algorithms, (2) Artifical Intelligence and Machine Learning, (3) Systems, and (4) Technologies for Emerging Markets.  

Responsibilities for my current role include leadership of the lab, setting direction and culture of the lab, hiring and career development of staff, working with senior management in product groups to influence their technology decisions, and with academic community to set up and sustain collaborative relationships.

My individual research intrests are in designing, building and analyzing computer systems in a principled manner. Over the years I have worked on various topics including Hardware and Software Verification, Type Systems, Language Design, Distributed Systems, Security and Privacy. My current research interest is in automating specific programming tasks by combining Program Synthesis and Machine Learning.

I was co-winner of the the CAV 2011 Award for “contributions to software model checking, specifically the development of the SLAM/SDV software model checker that successfully demonstrated computer-aided verification techniques on real programs.” I was elected ACM Fellow in 2015 for contributions to software analysis and defect detection. I am also a recent Fellow of Indian National Academy of Engineering.

CS academic and research community activities are run by volunteers, and I voulnteer actively. I serve on the editorial board of CACM magazine for Special Regional Sections. I co-founded the ISEC conference series in India. I was general chair for POPL 2015 (POPL is ACM's flagship conference for programming languages) in India, and program co-chair for CAV 2005  (CAV is the flagship verification conference) in Edinburgh. I have also served on numerous program committees of CS conferences. I have co-taught many courses, and co-advised PhD students over time.
